intro: Viguiera nonneaefolia, commonly known as the Mexican ironweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a rough texture, while its flowers are typically pink to purple in color. Viguiera nonneaefolia is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
